meanings.definition: A warning of danger or an urgent call to action.
meanings.sent1: The loud alarums from the fire alarm alerted everyone to evacuate the building.
meanings.sent2: The police siren blared with alarums as they rushed to the scene.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected alarums of the car horn made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sudden alarums of thunder warned of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The shrill alarums of the whistle urged the players to start the game.

meanings.definition: A loud noise or disturbance, typically signaling an emergency.
meanings.sent1: The alarums of the crashing waves against the rocks echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: The loud alarums of the fire alarm filled the building with urgency.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected alarums of the barking dog startled the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The constant alarums of the car alarms in the city can be quite annoying.
meanings.sent5: The piercing alarums of the ambulance siren pierced the silence of the street.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel anxious or alarmed.
meanings.sent1: The news of the approaching storm alarums the residents living near the coast.
meanings.sent2: The sudden loud noise alarums the sleeping baby, making it cry.
meanings.sent3: The prankster enjoys alaruming his friends by jumping out and shouting 'Boo!'
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the haunted house alarums the visitors, making them shiver.
meanings.sent5: The dark shadow lurking in the alley alarums the pedestrians, causing them to walk faster.
